docs.snippet: The yacht squadron has dispersed; the cruise has terminated earlier than I could have desired. It has been productive of health and pleasure to the yachtmen and their guests.

headline.main: THE YACHT RACE.; The Controversy as to the Winning Yacht--The Best Yacht-Builders in the Country.

docs.lead_paragraph: The yacht squadron has dispersed; the cruise has terminated earlier than I could have desired. It has been productive of health and pleasure to the yachtmen and their guests.

headline.main: LATER FROM HAVANA.; Arrival of the Quaker City New Regulations for Coolie Immigration, &c.

docs.snippet: By the steamer Etna from Liverpool, we have received letters from our Correspondents on board the U.S. frigate Niagara on her way to Japan with the Ambassadors. She left this port on the 30th of June and the 17th of July had reached the Cape de Verde...

headline.main: THE JAPANESE EMBASSY.; FROM THE JAPANESE ON THEIR WAY HOME, NEWS OF THE NIAGARA. What The Japs Think of Their Visit to America. Tommy's Reminiscences of Travel--He writes Love-letters and wants to come back--How the Japanese conduct themselves--Memoranda of the Voyage of the Niagara. Further Details of the Voyage--Habits and Occupations of the Japanese--What the Ambassadors Think of their Visit--An official Dinner.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the steamer Etna from Liverpool, we have received letters from our Correspondents on board the U.S. frigate Niagara on her way to Japan with the Ambassadors. She left this port on the 30th of June and the 17th of July had reached the Cape de Verde Islands, from which points our dispatches were forwarded to England and thence to this country.

headline.main: FROM RIO JANEIRO.; Interesting Celebration of the Fourth of July The United States Minister not Present Arrival of Prince Alfred Wreck of an American Vessel Political, Naval,and General Intelligence.

docs.snippet: We have news of our old friends, the Japanese Ambassadors. On the 16th of July they had got as far as the Cape de Verde Islands, on their way home. The skies had been propitious. They had had but little wind, and consequently but little sea-sickness.
docs.lead_paragraph: We have news of our old friends, the Japanese Ambassadors. On the 16th of July they had got as far as the Cape de Verde Islands, on their way home. The skies had been propitious. They had had but little wind, and consequently but little sea-sickness.

docs.snippet: Henceforth let it be remembered that there are two Blondins, not in the field, but on the ropes. The long-heralded Faring made his d but at Niagara Falls on Wednesday last. The cable on which he performed was stretched across the river a third of a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Henceforth let it be remembered that there are two Blondins, not in the field, but on the ropes. The long-heralded Faring made his d but at Niagara Falls on Wednesday last. The cable on which he performed was stretched across the river a third of a mile below the Clifton House, and was in length nearly double that on which Blondin has been exhibiting.

docs.snippet: The steamship Glasgow, from Liverpool on the 8th, and Queenstown on the 9th, passed Cape Race on Friday night. A brief summary of her news, which is two days later, has been telegraphed. We have also London journals to the 7th inst., by the Cunard...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Glasgow, from Liverpool on the 8th, and Queenstown on the 9th, passed Cape Race on Friday night. A brief summary of her news, which is two days later, has been telegraphed. We have also London journals to the 7th inst., by the Cunard steamship Etna, which arrived at this port yesterday.

docs.snippet: "Twenty minutes allowed for dinner!" Who, that has traveled, and that means everybody, along any of our lines of railroad, has not waited for a long time in earnest and hungry expectation of that sound?
docs.lead_paragraph: "Twenty minutes allowed for dinner!" Who, that has traveled, and that means everybody, along any of our lines of railroad, has not waited for a long time in earnest and hungry expectation of that sound?
